reviews.review_msg: I loved Dr. Fitzpatrick, she is always available to answer questions, and is even excited when asked questions! The lab is excellent, one of the few labs that I have taken that teaches you how to perform technical skills like PCR, Ligation, Cloning, Restriction Digests, and so much more.

Honestly one of the best and most interesting courses I have taken. Course material is directly connected to lab stuff. As long as you maintain attendance (therefore participating in class) you'll do perfectly fine.

A lot of material but the prof gives a lot of opportunities to learn the material through quizzes, handouts, and assignments. The course was tough but the prof did everything to make the material available.

She is a bit less approachable than an average prof, but she is doing the job very well.

If you love genetics and are willing to learn alone, you can do well. However, if you are an average student wanting to take this for credit do not take this course. She expects you to piece complex concepts together. She has a lot of quizzes, and assignments and doesn't even mark them on time. Overall she means well but does not know how to teach.

Kathleen is very knowledgeable about genetics and techniques in the field, but can get confused when explaining concepts/material and leads to students being confused. There is also often great leaps between what she teaches/gives examples of, and the questions she asks. Lots of reading, quizzes, worksheets, and assignments. A lot of work

She makes the worksheets really long and hard and she does not explain concepts well. She hands out too many assignments and quizzes that are even hard for herself to handle because she does not hand anything back on time. The etext is super long. She makes you turn on your cameras for exams and does not give you enough time to finish on purpose

Kathleen is a very nice person and very easy to talk to. She does really care about her students and wants to ensure that she is teaching the material in a way that students can understand. The course itself though is really difficult and I'd suggest only taking it if you want a job in a lab or have to or to fill a requirement.
Avoid

Would highly recommend. Lecture content is easy to do well in, its the labs that are more time consuming and difficult because of the lab instructor. Tests right from the notes, some questions are more applied, some more just explaining a process. Great notes, very fair and almost easy exams.

To do well: Read the lectures, prepare for labs, and study extra material that is given to you. Lectures were enjoyable, but not always necessary. Can't rely on textbook for help. Very little help outside of class, but try get some if you need it.
Material is tricky so need to keep up and understand fully! otherwise fair

Amazing prof, actually cares about his class and wants us to learn. Really a passionate guy. Would take him again any time. Class is not easy, be prepared to work. Take this class if you want to learn. Lectures are recorded.

Mumbles during lecture so it's next to impossible to follow. Notes are brief and focuses on a lot "how" things. But tests on "why"...and everything is examable..especially the side notes or those things you think are irrelevant/not important. No textbook/recordings..just his brief notes and whatever notes you take. Great guy nonetheless though

Dr. Mattsson is one of the best professors I have ever had. This course was was extremely interesting, and Dr. Mattsson was enthusiastic and knowledgeable about the subject. I would recommend this course and professor to anyone, and wish that I had the opportunity to take more classes taught by him.

He is one of the best professors I've ever had. He is very approachable and fair. Pay attention in the lecture. Office hrs: really helpful. Exams were fair, but the final exam was definitely harder than the midterm exam.

Lectures are definitely hard to follow since he goes off on tangents all the time. But despite this he's actually a very nice and approachable guy. Read the recommended text and listen in lecture! A very pretty interesting course. Up-scaled the final grade a lot. And yes, I do think he looks kind of cute.

Pretty easy class in. Mattsson is definitely a mumbler but his notes are well informed. Very understanding of students and willing to comprimise with their needs (ie: wants you to do well). Makes sure you know exactly what to expect when walking into an exam.
I took 357 with peter after i had him for 303's lab. He's really nice when approached and knowledgeable. Won't ruin your gpa

Peter has issues with teaching. One time he went on a 10 minute rant because half the class failed the midterm. His midterm was all mcq since strike occurred. His lectures were bland and boring, making it hard to understand because it had lots of pictures and very little writing. If you really want to learn, take it with someone else.
He is not the best professor because of the ways he teaches. However, he is passionate about biology and very caring whenever you talk to him.

Very friendly and knowledgeable professor. The course itself is not necessarily hard, but info heavy. His testing is fair if you put the time to study. He is very helpful and approachable. Recommend his course.
friendly guy, very upbeat

Great lab instructor. Very helpful and very understanding. Really patient and willing to explain things to you. Ridiculously easy quizzes and easy marker. Keep up with you lab notebook is teh only advice I have.
